item.title: VSCode vs Zed (vs GoLand) - Comparing Power Consumption
item.description: Preamble I loved Sublime Text. I really did. I used it for everyhting from remote python dev on supercomputers, to writing academic papers in LaTeX (see my old guide on getting it set up for proof). When VSCode came out with its “Remote Explorer” functionality I was torn. It was just too useful for the remote work I was doing, but it meant switching to a heavy electron app. I missed the responsiveness of Sublime Text, but I found a new peace in the added functionality of the VSCode extention ecosystem.
